title: Authors and Citation
text: Alex Slavenko. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Slavenko (2023). EndosymbiontModel: Run simulations using AGPIP Endosymbiont Model. R package version 0.0.2, https://cesaraustralia.github.io/EndosymbiontModel/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {EndosymbiontModel: Run simulations using the AGPIP Endosymbiont Model},   author = {Alex Slavenko},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://cesaraustralia.github.io/EndosymbiontModel/}, }

title: Run simulations using the AGPIP Endosymbiont Model
text: EndosymbiontModel can installed running following code: details TBA

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: species object defining life history function green peach aphid (Myzus persicae). Can used run endosymbiont model GPA.f_growth fitted using fit_custom data Whalon & Smilowitz 1979.f_loss fitted using fit_sigmoid data Maling et al. 2008.f_suscept fitted using fit_custom data Thackray et al. 2009.f_inoc fitted using fit_quadratic data Thackray et al. 2009.f_alate fitted using fit_custom data Thackray et al. 2009.

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: object class species; see species.

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: Maling, T., Diggle, .J., Thackray, D.J., Siddique, K.H.M., Jones, R..C., epidemiological model externally sourced vector-borne viruses applied Bean yellow mosaic virus lupin crops Mediterranean-type environment. Phytopathology, 98, 1280–1290 (2008) Thackray, D.J., Diggle, .J., Jones, R..C., BYDV PREDICTOR: simulation model predict aphid arrival, epidemics Barley yellow dwarf virus yield loss wheat crops Mediterranean-type environment. Plant Pathology, 58, 186–202 (2009)] Whalon, M.E., Smilowitz, Z., Temperature-dependent model predicting field populations green peach aphid, Myzus persicae. Canadian Entomologist, 111, 1025–1032 (1979)

title: Check species object — check_species
text: Checks validity species object

title: Check species object — check_species
text: object object class species; see species

title: Download SILO data — download_silo
text: Download weather station data SILO

title: Download SILO data — download_silo
text: date date download data YYYY-MM-DD format year year date var name variable download (e.g. max_temp, min_temp, daily_rain) path pathway output directory

title: Download SILO data — download_silo
text: raster selected weather data variable selected date

title: Endosymbiont model — endosym_model
text: Run simulation using endosymbiont model

title: Endosymbiont model — endosym_model
code: endosym_model(Pest, Crop, Beneficials = NULL, init, conds, plot = TRUE)

title: Endosymbiont model — endosym_model
text: Pest object class pest defining pest Crop object class crop defining crop Beneficials list objects class beneficial describing beneficials system init object class initial defining starting conditions simulation conds object class sim_conds defining simulation conditions plot TRUE (default) generate plots

title: Endosymbiont model — endosym_model
text: object class endosym_mod; see endosym_mod.

title: Endosymbiont model — endosym_model
text: Constructs endosymbiont model using provided pest, crop, beneficials, initial, sim_conds objects. Pest species feeds provided Crop. Vertical transmission endosymbiont defined using functions Pest. Horizontal transmission herbivory defined using functions Crop. element Beneficials list beneficial object functions defining interactions pest (e.g. predation, parasitism) impacts mortality endosymbiont transmission.

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: Fits function returns proportion offspring destined develop alates

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: omega inflection point logistic regression z logistic regression gradient parameter W logistic regression gradient parameter V logistic regression gradient parameter

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: Fits logistic regression curve determine proportion offspring destined become alate adults, based function defined cherry-oat aphids (Rhopalosiphum padi; Morgan 2000; Parry et al. 2006) $$ \frac{z}{1 + e^{-W \cdot \left( \frac{\text{density}}{V} - \omega \right)}} $$

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: Morgan, D., Population dynamics bird cherry-oat aphid, Rhopalosiphum padi (L.), autumn winter: modelling approach. Agricultural Forest Entomology, 2, 297-304 (2000) Parry, H.R., Evans, .J., Morgan, D., Aphid population response agricultural landscape change: spatially explicit, individual-based model. Ecological Modelling, 199, 451-463 (2006)

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_alate(67.418, 0.993, 0.076, 300) plot(seq(0, 15000, by = 1), my_func(seq(0, 15000, by = 1)), type = "l")

what: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: Fits function returns scaled daily fecundity based population density

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: D carrying capacity (inflection point) p rate decline fecundity

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: Fits curve based Bannerman & Roitberg (2014) describe daily fecundity changes density: $$ 1 - \frac{1}{1 + e^{-p \cdot (\text{density} - D)}} $$

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: Fits curve using generalised additive model

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: x vector numeric predictor variable y vector numeric response variable, length x k passed onto smooth term x. Default length(x) - 1

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: Fits generalised additive model (GAM) using mgcv package.

what: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: Fits function returns number emigrating adults

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: x population newly emerged adults

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: number emigrating adults

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: base emigration rate 20% newly emerged adults

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: Thackray, D.J., Diggle, .J., Berlandier, F.., Jones, R..C., Forecasting aphid outbreaks epidemics Cucumber mosaic virus lupin crops Mediterranean-type environment. Virus Research, 100, 67-82 (2004)

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: Fits function returns mortality rate based inverse Gompertz survival function

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: delta shape mortality curve beta rate decline

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: mortality rate function pass Endosymbiont model. Fits Gomeprtz survival function calculate mortality rate: $$ 1 - e^{\left(\frac{\delta}{\beta}\left(1 - e^{\beta \cdot \text{{age}}}\right)\right)} $$

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: Gompertz, B., nature function expressive law human mortality new mode determining value life contingencies. Philosophical Transactions Royal Society London, 115, 513-583 (1825)

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_gompertz(0.00188, 0.13) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit null — fit_null
text: Fits function returns 0 given input value

title: Fit null — fit_null
text: output value return (default 0) x vector class

title: Fit null — fit_null
text: function accepts x returns value output

title: Fit null — fit_null
text: function pass Endosymbiont model can used nullify process. default output 0, therefore can used stand-process modelled function accepting input vector. However, output can changed different value (e.g., 1) required, long null process supposed return constant value.

title: Fit null — fit_null
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_null(0) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")   my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_null(1) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")   my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_null(0.5) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: Fits function returns scaled daily fecundity based daily temperature

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: coefficient 1 b coefficient 2 topt optimum reproductive temperature

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: Fits scaled quadratic curve produce temperature scalar ranging 0 1: $$   \frac{\cdot x^2 + b \cdot x}{\cdot T_{opt}^2 + b \cdot T_{opt}} $$

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_quadratic(-0.7611, 31.9847, 25) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: Fits function returns mortality rate based daily rainfall

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: x daily rainfall mm

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: mortality rate

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: mortality rate function pass Endosymbiont model. Fits curve using Thackray definition rainfall-induced mortality aphids (Thackray et al. 2004, modified green peach aphid Maling et al. 2010): $$ \text{{Rainfall Mortality}} = 0.026 \cdot \text{{Rainfall}} - 0.33 $$ mortality increases linearly daily rainfall increases 15 mm capped maximum 0.5.

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: Thackray, D.J., Diggle, .J., Berlandier, F.., Jones, R..C., Forecasting aphid outbreaks epidemics Cucumber mosaic virus lupin crops Mediterranean-type environment. Virus Research, 100, 67-82 (2004) Maling, T., Diggle, .J., Thackray, D.J., Siddique, K.H.M., Jones, R..C. epidemiological model externally acquired vector-borne viruses applied Beet western yellows virus Brassica napus crops Mediterranean-type environment. Crop Pasture Science, 61, 132-144 (2010)

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_rainfall_thack() plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: Fits function returns aphid nymph development rate based daily temperature

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
code: fit_wang(H, r, Topt, Tupper, Tlower, bound)

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: H development rate scalar r development rate scalar Topt optimum development temperature Tupper upper development threshold Tlower lower development threshold bound boundary width thresholds

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: development rate function pass Endosymbiont model. Fits curve using Wang model (Wang et al. 1982): $$ \left(\frac{H}{{1 + e^{-r \cdot (T - T_{\text{opt}})}}}\right) \cdot \left(1 - e^{- \frac{T - T_{\text{lower}}}{\text{bound}}}\right) \cdot \left(1 - e^{- \frac{T_{\text{upper}} - T}{\text{bound}}}\right) $$

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: Wang, R.S., Lan, Z.X., Ting, Y.C., Studies mathematical models relationships insect development temperature. Acta Ecologica Sinica, 2, 47-57 (1982)

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_wang(24.1, 0.152, 18.09, 32.79, 2.84, 1.8977) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: Fits function returns daily fecundity based cohort adult age

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: K fecundity rate scalar iota shape fecundity curve gamma scale fecundity curve eta locations fecundity curve

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: Fits curve using Weibull distribution describe daily fecundity changes adult age: $$ K \cdot \frac{\iota}{\gamma} \cdot  \left( \frac{\text{age} - \eta}{\gamma} \right)^{\iota - 1} \cdot e^{-\left( \frac{\text{age} - \eta}{\gamma} \right)^\iota} $$

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: Weibull, W., statistical distribution function wide applicability. Journal Applied Mechanics, 18, 293-297 (1951)

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_weibull(58, 1.885, 5.953, 0) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
title: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
text: S4 class store species' life history functions endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
text: name name species reproduction form reproduction species ("sexual", "asexual") development form development species ("holometabolous", "hemimetabolous) f_growth Function growth rate ~ temperature f_loss Function mortality rate ~ rainfall f_suscept Function infection susceptability ~ temperature f_inoc Function inoculation efficiency ~ temperature f_alate Function production alates ~ proportion carrying capacity (density)

title: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
code: GPA <- new("species",   name = "Myzus persicae",   reproduction = "asexual",   development = "hemimetabolous",   f_growth = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("custom",     c(4, 8.87, 11.82, 14.22, 17.13, 19.92, 22.61, 25.77, 27.80, 30),     c(0, 0.06, 0.09, 0.11, 0.13, 0.15, 0.16, 0.14, 0.04, 0)),   f_loss = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_sigmoid(0.55, 1.5, 3.5),   f_suscept = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("custom",     seq(0, 40, 4)[1:10],     c(0, 0.15, 0.3, 0.45, 0.6, 0.75, 0.75, 0.6, 0.3, 0)),  f_inoc = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("quadratic", 0.8, 22, 0, 40),  f_alate = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("custom",   seq(0, 1, 0.1),   c(0.01, 0.22, 0.35, 0.45, 0.53, 0.6, 0.66, 0.72, 0.76, 0.78, 0.79))  ) #> Error in initialize(value, ...): object 'fit_tpc' not found  GPA #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'GPA' not found
